page.title: 11Great Coxwell Buildings
page.content: The early 13th century medieval monastic Tithe Barn(length 152feet, width 44feet,height 48feet)originally belonged to Beaulieu Abbey.Constructed with stone walls & stone tiled roof,it stands at the bottom of the Holloway. There are east and west doors,the larger north and south doors were added in the 18th century.The building now belongs to the National Trust and is used for storage of farm machinery and fodder.A lunch was held in the Barn in 1977 for Queen Elizabeth II's Silver Jubilee. The adjacent courthouse is possibly the oldest house in the village with a south wall contemporary with the Barn and a 16th century window in the kitchen.Danes House is about the 2nd oldest & is believed to have been built about 1680.
